title: Astronomische Nederlandse Satelliet
name: Astronomische Nederlandse Satelliet (ANS)
descript: Astronomische Nederlandse Satelliet (ANS) was launched by a American Scout rocket from the Western Test Range, California, on August 30 1974 into a polar orbit. It was a collaborative effort between the Netherlands (NIVR) and USA (NASA). The University of Groningen and Utrecht (Netherlands) provided the Ultraviolet and the Soft X-ray experiments, while the American Science and Engineering company provided the hard X-ray experiment.
features: Three axis stabilization, with Z axis always pointed sunward and pointing accuracy of 1′ for any location perpendicular to the sun-pointing axis.

instruments.name: Ultraviolet Experiment
instruments.descript: Parabolic mirror with proportional counter on the focal plane

instruments.name: Hard X-ray Experiment (SXX)
instruments.descript: Bragg Crystal Assembly to search for Si lines

highlights: Detection of X-ray from stellar coronae (Capella)
First detection of X-ray flares from UV Ceti and YZ CMi
